Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Summaries: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring themes of love, wealth, and the American Dream through the story of Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

Title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Summaries: The first book in the Harry Potter series, a fantasy story about a young orphan boy who discovers he is a wizard and attends a school of magic.

Title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Author: Douglas Adams
Summaries: A comedic science fiction novel following the adventures of an unwitting human and his alien friend as they travel through space and time.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Summaries: A thriller novel centered around a symbologist and a cryptologist who follow clues to unravel a conspiracy involving the Catholic Church and the Holy Grail.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Summaries: A classic novel of manners set in 19th-century England, exploring the relationships and social customs of the wealthy Bennet family.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Summaries: A classic novel set in the 1930s South, exploring themes of racism, prejudice, and social inequality through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

Author: George Orwell
Summaries: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where individualism is suppressed and the government controls every aspect of citizens' lives.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summaries: A fantasy epic following hobbit Frodo Baggins and his companions as they journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the evil Sauron.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Summaries: A novel following the misadventures of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who is disillusioned with the adult world.

Title: To the Lighthouse
Author: Virginia Woolf
Summaries: A novel exploring the inner lives of a family as they vacation on the Isle of Skye, Scotland.

Title: The Shining
Author: Stephen King
Summaries: A horror novel about a family who becomes trapped in a haunted hotel during the winter.

Title: The Hunger Games
Author: Suzanne Collins
Summaries: A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic world where teenagers are forced to fight to the death in an annual televised event.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Summaries: A novel following a shepherd boy who embarks on a journey to find a treasure and discovers the importance of following one's dreams.

Title: Little Women
Author: Louisa May Alcott
Summaries: A classic novel following the lives of four sisters as they grow up and navigate the challenges of womanhood during the American Civil War.

Title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Author: Stieg Larsson
Summaries: A thriller novel following a journalist and a computer hacker as they investigate a decades-old disappearance and uncover a web of corruption and violence.

Title: Animal Farm
Author: George Orwell
Summaries: A political allegory in which a group of farm animals rebel against their human farmer and establish their own government, which becomes corrupt and oppressive.

Title: The Diary of a Young Girl
Author: Anne Frank
Summaries: A memoir in which a Jewish girl documents her experiences hiding with her family during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
Summaries: A Gothic novel about a scientist who creates a living being from human parts and is horrified by the monster he has made.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Bronte
Summaries: A Gothic novel set in the moors of England, following the tumultuous relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

Title: Great Expectations
Author: Charles Dickens
Summaries: A coming-of-age novel following the life of an orphan boy named Pip and his journey to becoming a gentleman.

Title: The Girl on the Train
Author: Paula Hawkins
Summaries: A psychological thriller about a woman who becomes embroiled in a missing persons investigation after witnessing something from her train window.

Title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
Summaries: A collection of short stories featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his partner Dr. Watson solving crimes in Victorian London.

Title: War and Peace
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Summaries: An epic novel by Leo Tolstoy that follows the lives of several aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars.

Title: The Bell Jar
Author: Sylvia Plath
Summaries: A semi-autobiographical novel by Sylvia Plath about a young woman's descent into mental illness.

Title: Gone Girl
Author: Gillian Flynn
Summaries: A psychological thriller about a man whose wife disappears and he becomes the prime suspect in her disappearance.

Title: Les Miserables
Author: Victor Hugo
Summaries: A novel by Victor Hugo that follows the lives of several characters in 19th century France, including an ex-convict and a police inspector.

Title: The Outsiders
Author: S.E. Hinton
Summaries: A coming-of-age novel by S.E. Hinton about a group of working-class teenagers in Oklahoma.

Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy
Summaries: A post-apocalyptic novel by Cormac McCarthy about a father and son's journey through a barren and dangerous landscape.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Summaries: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky that follows a young man who commits a murder and struggles with guilt and redemption.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Author: Oscar Wilde
Summaries: A novel by Oscar Wilde about a man who remains young and beautiful while a portrait of him ages and shows the physical toll of his hedonistic lifestyle.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summaries: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien about a hobbit who embarks on an adventure with dwarves to reclaim their treasure from a dragon.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Bronte
Summaries: A novel by Charlotte Bronte about a young woman who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer, Mr. Rochester.

Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Summaries: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky about a dysfunctional family and the murder of the father, with themes of religion, philosophy, and morality.

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Author: Alexandre Dumas
Summaries: A novel by Alexandre Dumas about a man who is wrongfully imprisoned and seeks revenge on those who betrayed him after he escapes and becomes wealthy.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Summaries: A Gothic horror novel by Bram Stoker about a vampire who terrorizes Victorian England.

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Author: John Steinbeck
Summaries: A novel by John Steinbeck about a family's journey from Oklahoma to California during the Great Depression.

Title: Beloved
Author: Toni Morrison
Summaries: A novel by Toni Morrison about a former slave who is haunted by the ghost of her baby daughter.

Title: The Color Purple
Author: Alice Walker
Summaries: A novel by Alice Walker about a young black woman in rural Georgia who overcomes abuse and oppression to find her own voice and independence.

Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
Summaries: A novel by Gabriel Garcia Marquez that tells the story of the Buendia family over several generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

Title: The Handmaid's Tale
Author: Margaret Atwood
Summaries: A dystopian novel by Margaret Atwood about a woman living in a future where the government has established a totalitarian regime based on a strict interpretation of the Bible.

Title: The Kite Runner
Author: Khaled Hosseini
Summaries: A novel by Khaled Hosseini about a boy growing up in Afghanistan and his friendship with the son of his father's servant, set against the backdrop of the Soviet invasion and later Taliban rule.

Title: A Game of Thrones
Author: George R.R. Martin
Summaries: The first book in the "A Song of Ice and Fire" series by George R.R. Martin, a fantasy epic set in a medieval-like world with political intrigue, war, and supernatural elements.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Summaries: A dystopian novel by Aldous Huxley about a future society where people are conditioned from birth to conform to a rigid social hierarchy and where pleasure and consumption are valued above all else.

Title: Anna Karenina
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Summaries: a novel about the tragic love affair between Anna, a married aristocrat, and Count Vronsky, a wealthy military man. The novel explores themes of love, adultery, family, and society in 19th century Russia.

Title: The Sun Also Rises
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Summaries: a novel that follows a group of American and British expatriates as they travel from Paris to Pamplona, Spain, to watch the running of the bulls and participate in the bullfights. The novel explores themes of disillusionment, masculinity, and the Lost Generation.

Title: The Old Man and the Sea
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Summaries: a short novel about an aging fisherman named Santiago who sets out on a fishing expedition in the Gulf Stream and catches a giant marlin. The novel explores themes of determination, endurance, and the human struggle against nature.

Title: The Nightingale
Author: Kristin Hannah
Summaries: Set in World War II France, this novel follows the story of two sisters as they navigate love, loss, and the dangers of war.

Title: The Name of the Wind
Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Summaries: This novel tells the story of Kvothe, a legendary wizard, as he recounts his life story to a chronicler in a tavern.

Title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
Author: Rebecca Skloot
Summaries: This book tells the true story of Henrietta Lacks, a woman whose cancer cells were taken without her knowledge and became the basis for many medical breakthroughs.

Title: The Road Less Traveled
Author: M. Scott Peck
Summaries: This book explores the psychology of love, growth, and change, offering insights and guidance for personal development.

Title: Americanah
Author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
Summaries: This novel tells the story of Ifemelu, a young Nigerian woman who moves to the United States and experiences the complexities of race, identity, and cultural assimilation.

Title: The Night Circus
Author: Erin Morgenstern
Summaries: This novel follows the competition between two young magicians in a mystical, traveling circus

Title: The Power of One
Author: Bryce Courtenay
Summaries: Set in South Africa during World War II, this novel tells the story of a young boy named Peekay and his journey to become a boxing champion while confronting the injustices of apartheid.

Title: The Shadow of the Wind
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zaf�n
Summaries: Set in post-World War II Barcelona, this novel follows a young boy named Daniel as he becomes obsessed with a mysterious book and sets out to uncover the author's identity.

Title: The Book Thief
Author: Markus Zusak
Summaries: Set in Nazi Germany, this novel tells the story of a young girl named Liesel who steals books and shares them with others to find solace during the war.

Title: Educated
Author: Tara Westover
Summaries: This memoir tells the story of the author's upbringing in a strict, fundamentalist family in rural Idaho and her journey to get an education and break free from her past.

Title: The Underground Railroad
Author: Colson Whitehead
Summaries: Follows the journey of an escaped slave through the American South

Title: The Immortalists
Author: Chloe Benjamin
Summaries: Four siblings visit a psychic who tells them the dates of their deaths, and each deals with their fate differently

Title: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
Author: Neil Gaiman
Summaries: A man returns to his childhood home and recalls a magical world he experienced as a boy

Title: The Night Watchman
Author: Louise Erdrich
Summaries: A Chippewa councilman fights against a congressional bill that would terminate his tribe's sovereignty in the 1950s

Title: An Absolutely Remarkable Thing
Author: Hank Green
Summaries: A young woman becomes famous overnight after discovering a mysterious statue and uploading a video to YouTube

Title: The Immortalists
Author: Chloe Benjamin
Summaries: Four siblings visit a psychic who tells them the dates of their deaths, and each deals with their fate differently

Title: The Night Circus
Author: Erin Morgenstern
Summaries: Two young magicians compete in a mysterious circus that only appears at night

Title: The Silent Patient
Author: Alex Michaelides
Summaries: A psychological thriller about a therapist who becomes obsessed with her patient, a woman who has been silent since the murder of her husband

Title: Normal People
Author: Sally Rooney
Summaries: A story of the complex relationship between two young people from a small town in Ireland who go on to attend university in Dublin.

Title: The Sympathizer
Author: Viet Thanh Nguyen
Summaries: The novel follows a communist double agent as he spies on South Vietnam for the North, and explores themes of identity and betrayal.

Title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
Author: Haruki Murakami
Summaries: A surreal, dreamlike novel about a man's search for his wife and his own identity, featuring elements of history, fantasy, and philosophy

Title: The Water Dancer
Author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
Summaries: A young slave with a unique power embarks on a journey of self-discovery to find freedom.

Title: The Testaments
Author: Margaret Atwood
Summaries: The long-awaited sequel to The Handmaid's Tale, following the lives of three women in Gilead.

Title: Circe
Author: Madeline Miller
Summaries: A retelling of the Greek myth of Circe, the sorceress, as she discovers her own power.

Title: The Overstory
Author: Richard Powers
Summaries: A novel about the interconnection of trees and people, and the importance of the natural world.

Title: Where the Crawdads Sing
Author: Delia Owens
Summaries: A young woman grows up alone in the marshes of North Carolina, and becomes embroiled in a murder investigation.

Title: An American Marriage
Author: Tayari Jones
Summaries: A couple's marriage is tested when the husband is wrongfully imprisoned for a crime he did not commit.

Title: Homegoing
Author: Yaa Gyasi
Summaries: The story of two half-sisters, one sold into slavery and one married to a slave trader, and their descendants over the course of several generations.

Title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
Author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
Summaries: A legendary Hollywood actress recounts her life and career to a young journalist, revealing her many secrets along the way.

Title: All the Light We Cannot See
Author: Anthony Doerr
Summaries: A blind French girl and a German boy's lives intersect during World War II, in this Pulitzer Prize-winning novel.

Title: The Dutch House
Author: Ann Patchett
Summaries: Two siblings are exiled from their childhood home by their stepmother, and must reconcile with their past and each other.

Title: The Secret History
Author: Donna Tartt
Summaries: The story of a group of classics students at a liberal arts college in New England who are drawn into murder and psychological suspense.

Title: The Name of the Rose
Author: Umberto Eco
Summaries: Set in an Italian monastery in the year 1327, the story follows the investigation of a series of mysterious deaths by Franciscan friar William of Baskerville.

Title: The Time Traveler's Wife
Author: Audrey Niffenegger
Summaries: The story of a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably, and his wife, who must cope with his frequent absences and dangerous experiences.

Title: The Goldfinch
Author: Donna Tartt
Summaries: The story of a young boy named Theo Decker, who survives a terrorist bombing at an art museum, and goes on to become involved in the underworld of art crime.

Title: The Silent Wife
Author: A.S.A. Harrison
Summaries: A psychological thriller about a woman named Jodi and her husband Todd, whose marriage begins to unravel when Todd begins an affair with a much younger woman.

Title: The Immortal Rules
Author: Julie Kagawa
Summaries: The story of a young girl named Allison Sekemoto, who becomes a vampire in order to survive in a post-apocalyptic world overrun by vampires.

Title: The Help
Author: Kathryn Stockett
Summaries: Set in 1960s Mississippi, the story follows a young white woman named Skeeter, who decides to write a book about the experiences of black maids working in white households.

Title: The Martian
Author: Andy Weir
Summaries: The story of an astronaut named Mark Watney, who is stranded alone on Mars after his crew leaves him behind, and his struggle to survive and make contact with Earth.

Title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
Author: Rebecca Skloot
Summaries: The true story of Henrietta Lacks, a woman whose cancer cells were taken without her knowledge and used to develop the first immortal cell line, known as HeLa.

Title: The Nightingale
Author: Kristin Hannah
Summaries: The story of two sisters in Nazi-occupied France during World War II, and their struggle to survive and resist the occupation.

Title: The Glass Castle
Author: Jeannette Walls
Summaries: A memoir of the author's unconventional childhood, growing up with parents who were often homeless and struggling with addiction and mental illness.

Title: The Giver
Author: Lois Lowry
Summaries: Set in a dystopian society where emotions and memories are suppressed, the story follows a young boy named Jonas who is chosen to receive and keep all of the memories of the past.

Title: The Hunger
Author: Alma Katsu
Summaries: A supernatural horror novel that retells the story of the Donner Party, a group of American pioneers who became stranded in the Sierra Nevada mountains during the winter of 1846–47.

Title: The Immortalists
Author: Chloe Benjamin
Summaries: In 1969, the four Gold children hear of a woman said to be able to predict the day you will die. Each of them secretly visits her to learn their fate. The Immortalists explores the line between destiny and choice, reality and illusion, this world and the next.

Title: An Absolutely Remarkable Thing
Author: Hank Green
Summaries: The first in a duology, An Absolutely Remarkable Thing tells the story of a young woman who becomes an overnight celebrity after her viral video makes her the first person to make contact with an alien species. But fame comes with a price, and she must grapple with the consequences of her newfound stardom.

Title: Normal People
Author: Sally Rooney
Summaries: Normal People follows the complex and evolving relationship between Marianne and Connell, two teenagers from a small Irish town. Over the course of several years and many ups and downs, they struggle to understand each other and themselves.

Title: The Sympathizer
Author: Viet Thanh Nguyen
Summaries: The Sympathizer tells the story of a double agent during the Vietnam War and its aftermath. As he navigates the treacherous waters of politics and ideology, he must grapple with his own loyalties and beliefs.

Title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
Author: Haruki Murakami
Summaries: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle follows the surreal and often unsettling experiences of a man searching for his missing wife. As he delves deeper into the mysteries surrounding her disappearance, he is forced to confront the darker aspects of his own past and psyche.

Title: The Water Dancer
Author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
Summaries: The Water Dancer tells the story of a young man named Hiram Walker, who possesses a mysterious power to transport people and things through space. As he navigates the perilous world of slavery and abolitionism in the American South, he must confront the legacy of his own family and the true nature of his gift.

Title: Circe
Author: Madeline Miller
Summaries: Circe reimagines the story of the witch from The Odyssey, giving her a fully-realized backstory and agency. As she navigates the world of the gods and mortals, she must confront the limitations of her power and the consequences of her choices.

Title: The Overstory
Author: Richard Powers
Summaries: The Overstory weaves together the stories of nine disparate characters, all of whom have unique and complicated relationships with trees. As they navigate the challenges of modern life, they begin to see the natural world in a new and transformative way.

Title: Where the Crawdads Sing
Author: Delia Owens
Summaries: Where the Crawdads Sing follows the story of Kya, a young woman living alone in the marshes of North Carolina. As she navigates a harsh and unforgiving world, she must also confront the legacy of her family and the truth about a local murder.

Title: Educated
Author: Tara Westover
Summaries: Educated is a memoir written by Tara Westover
column8: which tells the story of her journey from growing up in a strict and isolated household in rural Idaho to pursuing higher education at some of the most prestigious universities in the world.
